poem:
### Speed and Grace

On the grey ribbon of tarmac,  
machines surge forward,  
a man driven by art  
pushes boundaries.  
In courts where judgment sleeps,  
need bends the rule,  
a journey allowed,  
as cameras wait to capture  
another path, where laughter  
and landscape meet  
in silent communion.
